application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: (T1) Red Snake Bark Maple (Acer capillipes)The central stem is dead and the tips of the other stems show signs of dieback. There is evidence of Honey fungus on adjacent trees as close as 5 metres.(p1) - Suggested works; Fell to ground level by sectional takedown.Remove all arising to green waste recycling centre.(T2) Yes (Taxus baccata) - Reduce all round by 1.5 metres and reshape crown. Lift over the pavement to give 2.3 metres clearance.Remove all arising to green waste recycling centre - Remaining size of tree 8 metres high - 7 metres wide.(T3) Lime (Tilia platyphylis) - Suggested works; Remove the two lowest branches overhanging the road back to branch collar/branch bark ridge, to give 6 metres clearance over the road - Remove deadwood - Remove all arising to green waste recycling centre.(T4) Snowy mespil (Amelanchier lamarckii) - remove
decision_conditions: Works agreed to tree labelled T1
Works agreed to tree labelled T4
Works agreed to tree labelled T3
Works agreed to tree labelled T2
